_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:57:16 using v2.1
title: What are the long-term trends in NHS staff numbers?
analysis_commentary:
The total number of all NHS staff has increased between 2002 and 2013, the latest year for which data is available. However, the extent and pattern of increase varies with staff type. Scientific, therapeutic, and technical staff have seen the greatest increase in numbers, followed by doctors. The staff group showing the smallest increase, only 15% over the past deacde, was qualified nursing staff.

Ambulance staff saw a decrease in numbers between 2005 and 2006, which can be associated with changes in the way the ambulance service was organised.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
